name: Virtuoso Lich
damage_resistances: necrotic; bludgeoning,piercing,and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks
languages: Common plus up to two other languages

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The virtuoso lich uses Corrupted Art. It then makes three Artistic Flourish attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

actions.name: Artistic Flourish
actions.desc: _Melee or Ranged Spell Attack:_ +9 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. _Hit:_ 18 (3d8+5) damage of the type chosen with the Versatile Artist trait plus 9 (2d8) force damage.

actions.name: Call Muse
actions.desc: The lich chooses one Beast or Humanoid it can see within 30 feet of it to be its muse. The target must succeed on a DC 17 WIS save or become the lich's muse and be charmed by the lich for 1 minute. While charmed, the muse has a speed of 0 and is incapacitated as it watches or listens to the lich's artistic expression. The muse can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's save is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the lich's Call Muse for the next 24 hours. If the muse suffers harm from the lich, it is no longer charmed. The lich can have only one muse at a time. If it charms another, the effect on the previous muse ends. If the lich is within 30 feet of its muse and can see its muse, the lich has advantage on its first Artistic Flourish attack each round against a creature that isn't its muse.

actions.name: Corrupted Art
actions.desc:
The lich hums a discordant melody, paints a crumbling symbol of death in the air, performs a reality-bending pirouette, or emulates some other expression of corrupted or twisted art and targets one creature it can see, other than itself, within 60 feet. This action's effects change, depending on if the target is Undead.
- **Non-Undead.** The target must make a DC 17 WIS save. On a failure, a creature is blinded, charmed, or deafened (the lich's choice) until the end of its next turn. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't incapacitated.
- **Undead.** The target regains 18 (4d8) HP. Healing that exceeds the target's HP maximum becomes temporary HP.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.desc:
The lich casts one of the following spells, using CHA as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17).
At will: _disguise self_, _mage hand_, _message_, _prestidigitation_
3/day each: _charm_, _hideous laughter_, _hold_, _invisibility_ (self only)
2/day each: _dispel magic_, _fear_, _dimension door_
1/day each: _irresistible dance_, _programmed illusion_, _seeming_

legendary_desc: The virtuoso lich can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The lich regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary_actions.name: Move
legendary_actions.desc: The lich moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary_actions.name: Unrestrained Art (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The lich unleashes the full force of its artistic talents. Each creature with 15 feet of the lich must make a DC 17 DEX save. On a failure, a creature takes 9 (2d8) damage of the type chosen with the Versatile Artist trait and is knocked prone. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't knocked prone.

special_abilities.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
special_abilities.desc: If the lich fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.

special_abilities.name: Rejuvenation
special_abilities.desc: If it has a phylactery, a destroyed lich gains a new body in 1d10 days, regaining all its HP and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the phylactery.

special_abilities.name: Turn Resistance
special_abilities.desc: The lich has advantage on saves against any effect that turns undead.

special_abilities.name: Undead Nature
special_abilities.desc: The lich doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

special_abilities.name: Undead Resilience
special_abilities.desc: The lich is immune to poison damage, to exhaustion, and to the poisoned condition.

special_abilities.name: Versatile Artist
special_abilities.desc: At the end of each long rest, the lich chooses one form of artistic expression, such as song, poetry, dance, fashion, paint, or similar. Until it finishes a long rest, the lich has immunity to one type of damage, which is associated with its artistic expression. For example, a lich expressing art through song or poetry has immunity to thunder damage, a lich expressing art through fashion has immunity to slashing damage, and a lich expressing art through paint has immunity to acid damage. This trait can't give the lich immunity to force, psychic, or radiant damage.
